intro: Pedicularis amoeniflora, commonly known as the sweet-scented lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant features a basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of pink and yellow. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. The species is characterized by its unique floral structure and adaptability to alpine environments.
